intro: Ruehssia tressensiae, commonly known as the Tressensia ruehssia, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments and prefers well-drained soil. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported antiseptic and analgesic properties. Due to habitat loss, Ruehssia tressensiae is considered endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
